private_information: I may move disks: A B C D E F G H (A is smallest, H is larger)
I cannot move disks I J K L M N O
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) B F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg (top->bottom) A D; right peg (top->bottom) C E

private_information: I may move disks: I J K L M N O (O is largest, I is smaller among my set)
I cannot move disks A B C D E F G H
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) B F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg (top->bottom) A D; right peg (top->bottom) C E

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate their move sequences
I will produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver
I must ensure actions remain distinct per agent and respect disk movement restrictions
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined, valid PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution for the given initial and goal states, targeting FastDownward

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial configuration: left peg top->bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg top->bottom B F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg top->bottom A D; right peg top->bottom C E
Legal move: move the top disk of a peg to another peg provided it is not placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A-H, agent_2 may only move disks I-O

pddl.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are responsible for moving disks A B C D E F G H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Output must be a plain ordered list of moves using the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, right and X is a disk label. Ensure the sequence is executable given the initial configuration and within your allowed disk set.
pddl.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not produce PDDL. If you lack information to plan beyond your permitted moves, provide the moves you can do without making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You are responsible for moving disks I J K L M N O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Output must be a plain ordered list of moves using the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, right and X is a disk label. Ensure the sequence is executable given the initial configuration and within your allowed disk set.
pddl.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not produce PDDL. If you lack information to plan beyond your permitted moves, provide the moves you can do without making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the ordered primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Your task is to validate and integrate these moves, ensure they jointly respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the agents' disk restrictions, keep action definitions distinct per agent, and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the cooperative multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. The PDDL should be suitable for the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. When modeling actions, keep moves from agent_1 and agent_2 distinct (for example use action names move_agent_1 and move_agent_2) and enforce that each action can only move the disks allowed to that agent.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Agent private infos: {agents->agent_1->private_information} and {agents->agent_2->private_information}. You will receive the agents' ordered move lists: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Integrate and validate these move lists so they form a correct cooperative plan that reaches the goal. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownward solver that represent the multi-agent moves and constraints. Keep actions distinct per agent and encode agent-specific disk movement permissions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
